cfo.subject: Foxwoods' $16.2M demand charge opportunity
cfo.body:
Quick question - do you know what percentage of Foxwoods' utility bill is demand charges vs actual energy consumption?

A Las Vegas casino recently achieved these verified results:

• 8.59% kW reduction (peak demand)
• Third-party verified over 12 months
• 25-40% IRR, 14-month payback

Based on your ~$180,000,000 annual energy spend, similar results would mean:

• Estimated demand charge savings: $1,391,580/year
• Direct EBITDA improvement: $15,462,000/year

The technology addresses harmonic distortion from gaming equipment - the hidden driver of inflated demand charges that LED upgrades and BMS can't touch.

cfo.subject: The $1.4M margin leak hiding in your utility bill
cfo.body:
Here's something most casino CFOs don't realize about demand charges...

That $16,200,000 you're paying annually isn't based on total energy consumed. It's based on your highest 15-minute spike each month. One brief peak = your entire month's rate.

Casinos typically pay 3-5x higher demand rates than office buildings because gaming equipment creates constant electrical spikes.

The math is simple: reduce peak demand by 8.59% (like the Vegas property), and $1,391,580 flows directly to EBITDA.

This isn't cost reduction - it's margin improvement on a controllable expense line.
cfo.cta: See your estimated demand charge breakdown

cfo.subject: Why your energy projects underdeliver on ROI
cfo.body:
Most casinos have tried LED upgrades and BMS systems. They help with kWh consumption, but they can't touch your demand charges.

Here's why: Gaming equipment creates 15-25% harmonic distortion in your electrical system. Every slot machine, every server creates electrical "noise" that inflates peak demand readings.

LED and BMS projects miss this completely. They reduce energy usage but leave the distortion untouched.

That's why the Vegas casino saw 8.59% demand reduction - we addressed the root cause, not just the symptoms.

Harmonic distortion is the hidden reason most energy ROI projections fall short.

cfo.subject: What would you do with an extra $1.4M/year?
cfo.body:
The solution is solid-state filtration installed at your electrical panels. Zero downtime, no integration complexity, no operational risk.

Here's our track record: 50,000+ installations worldwide, never achieved below 5% reduction. Full refund if we don't hit the 5% minimum.

Typical casino results: 25-40% IRR, 14-month payback. That beats most gaming floor equipment ROI.

For Foxwoods' scale, we're talking about $1,391,580 annually falling straight to EBITDA - money that's currently being wasted on inflated demand charges.

Pre-defined success criteria, full transparency, independent metering. If we don't hit our 5% minimum guarantee, full refund.

operations.body:
Most energy solutions require downtime or system integration. Here's why this is different...

Casino operations can't tolerate even seconds of power interruption. Gaming floors, surveillance systems, security - everything depends on continuous power.

Tune filters install directly into live electrical panels without any power interruption. No gaming system modifications. No integration requirements. No operational disruption.

The Vegas casino kept every slot machine, table game, and security system running during the entire installation. Their operations team didn't even notice we were there.

That's how you protect 99.9%+ uptime requirements while cutting $15M+ from operating costs.

facilities.subject: Why your energy projects probably underdelivered ROI
facilities.body:
Here's why your energy projects probably underdelivered on ROI...

Your gaming equipment (slots, table electronics, VFD-driven HVAC) creates 15-25% total harmonic distortion. Compare that to office buildings at 5-8% THD.

This harmonic distortion inflates your apparent power (kVA), which drives up demand readings even when you're using less actual power (kW).

It's why LED retrofits and BMS upgrades often fall short of projections - they reduce consumption but can't address the power quality issues inflating your demand charges.

Want the harmonic distortion analysis that explains the full technical picture?

The technology addresses energy waste at the source - delivering measurable sustainability impact that actually improves profitability.

Would you like to see the third-party verification report?

esg.subject: Board-ready carbon reduction data
esg.body:
Here's something your board might find interesting about measurable carbon reduction...

Most sustainability initiatives struggle with credible reporting. This Las Vegas casino got third-party verification:

• 8.59% energy demand reduction
• Quantified carbon impact for ESG reporting
• 12-month verified performance data
• Zero operational disruption

For WinStar's scale, this translates to ~60,130 tons CO2 reduction annually - the kind of measurable impact that supports 30-50% carbon reduction commitments.

The key? Addressing harmonic distortion in gaming equipment creates continuous demand reduction.

Want to download the carbon reduction analysis for your next board presentation?

esg.subject: Why most casino sustainability programs miss the mark
esg.body:
Most sustainability programs focus on the wrong metric for casinos...

They target energy consumption (kWh) when the real carbon leverage is in demand reduction (kW). Here's why:

• Gaming equipment creates harmonic distortion
• This forces higher peak demand from utilities
• Peak demand = highest carbon intensity

The Las Vegas casino understood this - achieved 8.59% kW reduction by filtering harmonics at the source.

Result? Continuous carbon reduction without touching operations or guest experience.

For WinStar's profile: ~60,130 tons CO2 reduction potential.

Interested in seeing the carbon impact model?

esg.subject: What if sustainability accelerated EBITDA?
esg.body:
What if you could accelerate carbon reduction AND improve EBITDA?

Solid-state energy filtration creates continuous demand reduction:

• No trade-off between sustainability and operations
• Measurable carbon impact for ESG reporting
• 25-40% IRR (sustainability that pays for itself)

**Our guarantee:** 50,000+ installations worldwide, never achieved below 5% reduction, full refund if we don't hit minimum.

WinStar projection: $8.59M annual savings + 60,130 tons CO2 reduction.

This is sustainability that strengthens your bottom line while hitting carbon targets.

Ready to review the ESG impact analysis?

esg.body:
